channel.title: jQuest2d - Java RPG Engine
channel.description:
This is basically an attempt at writing a SNES-style RPG-engine using Slick (OpenGL "game engine", it just removes the most boring bits of the programming such as communicating with opengl directly etc).
It has a very long way to go and quite a few problems that need to be resolved.
Check it out here: http://code.google.com/p/jquest2d/
Interested in being part of the project? Check this out: http://code.google.com/p/jquest2d/wiki/ToDo
Screenshots from Revision 20:
Map-Editor: [img]http://i45.tinypic.com/13yq6p5.png[/img]
Game Engine: [img]http://i47.tinypic.com/30049dl.png[/img]

item.title: jQuest2d - Java RPG Engine
item.dc:creator: @TripleBla TripleBla
item.description:
@TripleBla wrote:

hey i just wanted to comment,

What the fuck - is this!

cool I have these fucking horns on my head, Java Guru Horns! HURRAH!! HORNS! HAHAAHAHA.!?

I did something like this, except it was entitled: How to create 2Dimensional RPG Maps with a MapEditor and texture palette. It was coded in about 45 minutes. lol. on a crappy language :(… KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK, SPELJOHAN!

Read full topic

item.title: jQuest2d - Java RPG Engine
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Triton, post:44, topic:320479”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=416956.msg3097331#msg3097331 date=1263439389]

Lots of monitors actually work at a 60 Hz maximum though, meaning that even if the eye could perceive a difference, the game running faster wouldn’t really make a difference (unless the frames were distributed unevenly in time, and even then the limit would soon be reached).

It does make a difference. Even if the faster rendering itself won’t bring that many advantages, if you update at a faster rate your movements will be smoother. But I’d say for a 2D game it doesn’t really make much of a difference. When I played Counter-Strike I could very well see the difference between playing it at 72fps (the default) and 99.9 (the maximum). It was much smoother and easier to play.

liar
[/quote]

Contribute to a healthy discussion or shut up.[/quote]liar

Read full topic

item.title: jQuest2d - Java RPG Engine
item.dc:creator: @shock -shock-
item.description:
@shock wrote:

Killer-99-pkz:

WHY would you use OpenGL with this shittyquick game. l2 not render when nothing ingame changed. come to think of it using opengl with this would be ultimately slower. our eyes can see 72fps on avrg

To take some load off of the CPU maybe?
